thread.title: Britain sees economy grow by the fastest rate in a year in bumper Brexit boost, latest official figures show
thread.title_full: Britain sees economy grow by the fastest rate in a year in bumper Brexit boost, latest official figures show

author: Natasha Clark
title: Britain sees economy grow by the fastest rate in a year in bumper Brexit boost, latest official figures show
text:
Opinion BREXIT BOOST Britain sees economy grow by the fastest rate in a year in bumper Brexit boost, latest official figures show 
The economy expanded by 0.7 per cent in the final quarter of last year, boosted my manufacturing BY NATASHA CLARK Comments THE UK economy grew by the fastest rate in around a year, it was revealed today. 
In a fresh boost for Theresa May, the latest figures showed that the economy expanded by 0.7 per cent in the final quarter of last year after the Brexit vote. EPA Theresa May will be happy with the latest growth figures 
British manufacturers boosted the economy more than had previously been thought. 
The Office for National Statistics (ONS) said that for the three months up to December, previous estimates that the economy had grown by 0.6 per cent were revised up. And the weaker pound after Brexit pushed exports again too. 
However, the GDP growth for 2016 was put down slightly from two per cent to 1.8 per cent on the back of weaker exports in the first half of the year. PA:Press Association 3 Mrs May visited the Conservative candidate in Stoke in a pottery warehouse ahead of Thursday’s vote 
Despite the vote to leave the EU the economy remained strong, although there was a slight dip in business investment. 
The ONS said Germany just pipped us to the post to be the fastest growing economy in the G7 – it grew by 1.9 per cent compared to our 1.8 per cent. 
“Excluding oil and gas output, estimated UK GDP growth might actually have been revised up in 2016,” PwC’s chief economist John Hawksworth said. RELATED STORIES Britain’s post-Brexit economy continues to flourish with 0.6% growth in last quarter PM TRADE ALERT Theresa May warned leaving EU Customs Union trade bloc could lead to a 4.5 per cent fall in GDP by 2030 POST-BREXIT BOOM Bank of England hikes growth forecasts again as UK economy continues to defy doom-mongering Remoaners FROM GLOOM TO BOOM Bank of England boss Mark Carney makes u-turn over downbeat post-Brexit forecast THE SUN SAYS Britain could be the fastest growing economy in the developed world by 2050 - so pipe down Remoaners BREX-A-GEDDON Quitting Single Market and restricting immigration will wipe billions from economy, Theresa May warned highways from hell Theresa May urged to splash cash on decaying roads as report claims economy faces £300bn hit 
Ross Walker, chief economist at RBS said: “The bigger challenges are now upon us with inflation rising but the economy is approaching this in more resilient shape than we expected in the middle of last year after the Referendum.” Getty Images
